arts.ttl: Championship roundup: Coventry sink Watford to claim sixth successive win
arts.sum: Thomas-Asannte, Allen and Sakamoto seal 3-1 victory Ipswich beat West Brom, Stoke win at Portsmouth Coventry, the leaders, recorded their sixth win in a row with a 3-1 victory over 10-man Watford, putting the pressure on second-placed Middlesbrough, who are hosting Wrexham in a later kick-off. Frank Lampard’s side got off to a flying start when Brandon Thomas-Asante and Jamie Allen scored within the first seven minutes. Tatsuhiro Sakamoto made it 3-0 on 42 minutes before James Abankwah was sent off for the visitors. Imran Louza’s second-half penalty proved nothing more than a consolation for Javi Gracia’s side. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Coventry vs Watford predictions: Hornets heading for defeat against sensational Sky Blues
arts.sum: Jamie Griffith believes Championship leaders Coventry can record another win on Saturday but visitors Watford can at least get on the scoresheet at the CBS Arena.
